column1: Trump Says Iran’s Supreme Leader Killed in Strikes
U.S.-Israeli Attacks Threaten to Set Off Broader Regional Conflict
The attacks have already disrupted oil and gas shipments through the Persian Gulf.
Trump’s unilateral attack paves way for broader dispute over war powers.
‘Under this rubble, students are buried’: Iran says dozens are killed in strike on school.
U.S. Ability to Determine What Comes Next in Iran Might Be Limited

What to Know About the Attacks
For Trump, the Iran Attack Is the Ultimate War of Choice
There was no immediate threat from Iran. But the president saw a chance to push a weakened government over the edge, and he took it.
Iran Hits Back Across the Mideast, Targeting U.S. Bases and Allies
In his social media post announcing Khamenei’s death, Trump said without providing evidence that he is hearing Iranian security forces “no longer want to fight, and are looking for Immunity from us.”
U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres condemned the U.S. and Israeli strikes on Iran and the subsequent attacks by Iran on its neighbors, at a special meeting of the U.N. Security Council.
The emergency medical services in Israel reported that there was a “severe, severe missile strike that hit a building complex” in the central district of Israel.

U.S. Central Command said its forces have “successfully defended against hundreds of Iranian missile and drone attacks” launched in retaliation, and damage to American bases in the region has been minimal.
There have been no reports of U.S. casualties or combat-related deaths in the 12 hours since the United States and Israel launched strikes, U.S. Central Command said.
The Israeli military said it began another wave of attacks on Iranian aerial defense and missile launches in central Iran.
The conflict has quickly threatened the flow of oil out of the Middle East, which could make oil and other fuels more expensive.
Saudi Arabia’s foreign ministry said it successfully intercepted Iranian attacks aimed at the Riyadh region and the Eastern Province.
Kuwait’s state media said a drone struck the country’s main airport, citing the civil aviation authority. It said the drone caused minor injuries to workers.
In a letter to the U.N. Security Council, Iran’s foreign minister asked for the council to intervene and said Israel and the U.S. had violated international law.
Iran’s foreign minister said there were currently no backchannel negotiations taking place in an effort to end the fighting with the U.S. and Israel.
Four people were killed in Syria after an Iranian missile struck a building in the southern city of Sweida, according to Syria’s state news agency SANA.
Several videos verified by The Times showed a strike on a U.S. Navy base in Bahrain.
